Pre-Game Insights: Bulgaria got their Nations League campaign off to a solid start by securing a 0-0 away draw (at a neutral venue) with Belarus.
Ranked at 88 in the world by FIFA, Bulgaria have bottomed out in recent years and are trying to slowly rebuild.
Tasked with getting Bulgaria into League B of the Nations League is head coach Ilian Iliev Snr.
Iliev has overseen a run of seven matches without defeat since he took over from Mladen Krstajic, who was sacked in October 2023.
But despite being seven matches unbeaten, the Lions only have one win to point to.
That was in a friendly against Tanzania in March. The 1-0 win ended an eleven match winless run dating all the way back to November 2022.
Furthermore, Bulgaria finished bottom of their Euro 2024 qualifying group with no wins from their eight fixtures.
Northern Ireland will also be looking at this fixture as a winnable one.
The Irish got their Nations League campaign off to a winning start with a 2-0 victory over Luxembourg at Windsor Park on Thursday.
Early goals from Paddy NcNair and Daniel Ballard sealed the victory which saw the Irish go top of League 3 Group C.
Others: Home advantage could be the telling factor, and we feel that will be the difference between the two nations.
Bulgaria vs Northern Ireland will take place on Sunday, 8th September 2024.
The match will be played at Hristo Botev Stadium, Plovdiv, Bulgaria.
The match will be broadcast live on ITVX.
